page.title: 13Farming
page.content: Land use in this area can be divided into two main categories.Intensively managed grassland which is sown, fertilised and used for pasture or cut as hay or silage,accounts for about half the area of farmland.Rough grazing land though unsown and little fertilised is enclosed for grazing. Most of the intensively managed grassland is used for grazing cattle.Milk is produced and is either bottled at the farm or picked up daily by tanker and sent elsewhere for bottling and distribution.Some fields are sown and the grass is harvested and stored for use as fodder during the winter months.When the cows come to the end of their milking life they are sold as beef. Most of the farmland in the area is undulating and can only be used to produce grass.
